page.title: 16Folk Customs LISVANE
page.content: 1){Wedding customs}involve children tying a ribbon across the entrance to the churchyard to hold up newly-weds. The bridegroom has to throw a handful of coins to get though.2)In 1870 a local farmer a his wife bequeathed a sum of money to give finacial help to apprentices.Today the remnant is distributed to the{poor and needy}of the parish in late December.3)The Lisvane{community festival}is held annually during 2 weeks in June, and embrces art,drama, sport and drama and many other activities.May Day celebrations also take place,as does an annual Remembarance Day for the dead of the 2 Great Wars and a {Welsh {language} service is held monthly at Lisvane Baptist Church.
